Use a rainwater harvesting system to collect and store rainwater in tanks. This system can be used to water plants by pumping the stored water to the required areas.
Install a drip irrigation system that delivers water directly to the roots of the plants. This system can be used to water plants without wasting water.
Use a watering can to manually water plants. This method can be time-consuming but it ensures that plants are watered properly.
Install a greywater system that recycles water from sinks, showers, and washing machines for irrigation purposes.
Use a hydroponic system that uses water to grow plants without soil. This system is more efficient and requires less water than traditional soil-based systems.
